events.title: Victory in Europe Day (V-E Day)
events.description: Allied forces formally accept Nazi Germany's unconditional surrender, marking the end of World War II in Europe.
events.significance: Marks the end of World War II in the European theater, leading to the cessation of hostilities and the start of post-war reconstruction.

events.title: First Indianapolis 500 automobile race is announced
events.description: Plans for the inaugural Indianapolis 500-mile automobile race are announced, which will later become one of the most famous motorsport events.
events.significance: The Indianapolis 500 becomes a significant event in automotive racing history and American culture.

events.title: Liberation of Flossenbürg Concentration Camp
events.description: The United States forces liberate the Flossenbürg concentration camp in Germany during World War II.
events.significance: Represents a key moment in ending Nazi atrocities and rescuing prisoners of war and political prisoners.

events.title: Napoleon Bonaparte dies in exile
events.description: Napoleon Bonaparte, the former Emperor of the French and a major figure in European history, dies on the island of Saint Helena.
events.significance: Marks the end of the life of one of history's most influential military and political leaders.

events.title: The launch of the Pioneer 11 spacecraft by NASA
events.description: NASA launches Pioneer 11, the second spacecraft to explore the outer solar system and the first to encounter Saturn.
events.significance: Advanced human knowledge of the outer planets and continued space exploration efforts.
